meanings.definition: The state or condition of being fallible.
meanings.sent1: Her fallibilities were evident when she admitted her mistake.
meanings.sent2: We must accept our fallibilities and learn from them.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fallibilities, he always tried his best.
meanings.sent4: The team's fallibilities were exposed during the crucial match.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's fallibilities made her more relatable to her students.

meanings.definition: The tendency to make mistakes or errors.
meanings.sent1: His fallibilities often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: Acknowledging our fallibilities can help us improve.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his fallibilities in a lighthearted manner.
meanings.sent4: The fallibilities of the system became apparent after the data breach.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring our fallibilities can hinder our personal growth.

meanings.definition: Imperfections or weaknesses in judgment or reasoning.
meanings.sent1: She recognized her fallibilities and sought guidance.
meanings.sent2: The project's success was hindered by its fallibilities.
meanings.sent3: His fallibilities became the subject of friendly teasing among colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The fallibilities in his argument weakened his position.
meanings.sent5: The artist embraced his fallibilities and turned them into strengths.
